red yarn a and white approx 6cm 2 ½ inches from top to toes not yarn b less than 10m 11yds including hanging loop oddments of bear coloured yarn 4ply or dk yarn c less than 10m 11yds n o t i o n s a small circle of felt to reinforce the stitching on 2 25mm straight needles us size 1 uk/canada 13 the face a pair of double pointed needles 2 25mm us size 1 uk/canada 13 scraps of black yarn dk or 4ply for the eyes and a tapestry needle for sewing the seams nose a small amount of toy stuffing / carded wool g a u g e 6 inch length of ribbon 7 stitches x 10 row to 1 inch a couple of 8 inch lengths of strong yarn for gathering in the top of the head and the neck thanks for downloading this pattern it is quite an easy little pattern with no shaping or complicated stitches just the basics of casting on knitting and purling it is slightly fiddly though with the sewing on of the limbs and ears best done in natural daylight if you choose to you can work this pattern in thicker weight yarns with a larger needle size to give a larger decoration i hope that you find the pattern enjoyable and are pleased with the decorations that you make i have other free patterns available over on ravelry and a selection of patterns to buy too y a r n s u g g e s t i o n s there s a nice contrast in working the body part of this little decoration in a smooth cotton and the head ears and limbs in a fuzzy woollen yarn but you can choose whatever yarns you like i ve shown the pattern knitted up here in 4ply cotton yarn for the body and dk weight yarn for the head etc but you could use a thicker weight yarn along with larger needle sizes to make a larger decoration if you prefer e x t r a t i p s i hope you enjoy using this pattern i have written up some extra tips about knitting and finishing so please pop by for
